description: The critical binary file /usr/sbin/nvram is specifically designed for NVRAM operations, containing complete NVRAM access functions (nvram_get/nvram_set/nvram_unset/nvram_commit/nvram_getall). These functions may be called by other programs for NVRAM access.

The HTTP service program /usr/sbin/httpd is linked to libnvram.so and calls the nvram_set function, potentially used for storing configuration or status information. Further analysis of the calling context is required to assess security implications.

The UPnP service program /usr/sbin/upnpd is linked to libnvram.so but does not directly call NVRAM functions, potentially accessing NVRAM through indirect means. Further analysis is required to examine its interaction methods with NVRAM.
code_snippet: Dynamic section shows NEEDED library: libnvram.so
